BOARD OF EDUCATION
CITY OF ST. LOUIS
DIVISION OF AUDIO-VISUAL EDUCATION
1517 SOUTH THERESA AVENUE (4)
April 10, 1961
TO: Mr. Frank Schooley
FROM: Marguerite Fleming
RE: Individual assignments for Newcomers* Session
|‘m delighted that you can be with us for the Newcomers Session on Wednesday
morning, April 26.
Enclosed is a copy of the program. You will see that consustants are expected to
assemble at their respective tables at 11 o'clock, following the coffee break. As
newcomers arrive at the various tables it will be the job of consultants to try to
answer their questions and perhaps suggest other people who might be helpful and/
or special Institute sessions that should be profitable. Many of you are well quali¬
fied to pnswer questions in all of the categories selected; hence, it is possible that
a newcomer may be referred to you personally, even though his question may not be
related to your table topic - at least he can meet you and make a date for a later
conference.
Your Table Assignment: _
Table No. VI * __
Topic DEVELOPING AND PROMOTING COMMUNITY PROGRAMS_
Chairman Mr. Frank Schooley_
Will you please meet me in the ballroom at 9:00 a.m. so that we can get organized a
bit before guests arrive? The meeting is scheduled for 9:30.
Many thanks for being willing to help and for making the extra effort to arrive ecr’y.
See you soon.
P.S. Keith Tyler hopes that all old-timers will take a personal interest in helping to
introduce newcomers at this morning session as well as at the afternoon reception.
